intro: Cremanium rigidum, commonly known as the rigid cremanium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its upright, woody stems and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of pale pink or white flowers during the spring and summer months. Cremanium rigidum is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to cooler, high-altitude environments.
